intro: Spiesia platysema, commonly known as the flatleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Spiesia platysema is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
